means: residential universal network 家居通用网络
real user network 真实用户网络
Revolutionary United Nations 革命的联合国家

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"流动，涌出"之意。
means: flow ： 侧重水继续不断地往前流，不关心其流量的大小和速度的快慢。
run ： 指液体向任何方向流动，暗示比flow快而有力。
stream ： 指水或其它液体从源头流出，不断地朝某一方向流动，可用作引申。
pour ： 通常指从高向低或从上向下的急剧流动。也可作引申用。
run ： 最普通用词，指由于各种原因而急速奔跑。
jog ： 指从容不迫地慢跑。
race ： 多用于赛跑，指以最快速度奔跑。
trot ： 强调小跑时上下弹跳的动作，是介于跑与走之间轻快的快速运动。

word_mean: 设计水线面下， 最大横剖面或平行中体后端到船体最后端的部分。

sentence.Network_en: The ballot was re-run on Mr Todd's insistence after accusations of malpractice.
sentence.Network_cn: 因被控舞弊，在托德先生的坚持下重新进行了投票。

sentence.Network_en: The President's speeches are regularly reproduced verbatim in the state-run newspapers.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统的讲话通常会被一字不差地刊登在国有报纸上。

sentence.Network_en: Perot hoped to run another series of campaign infomercials.
sentence.Network_cn: 佩罗期待着新一轮的竞选宣传节目的播出。

jx.jx_en_mean: To find by chance; come upon.

lj.lj_ly: He run across a dog.
lj.lj_ls: 他偶然遇到只小狗.

lj.lj_ly: I ran across her in the public library yesterday.
lj.lj_ls: 我昨天在公共图书馆碰巧遇见了她。

lj.lj_ly: She ran across some old letters when she was looking for something else.
lj.lj_ls: 她找别的东西时, 偶然翻出几封过去的信。

lj.lj_ly: I just thought you might have run across him before.
lj.lj_ls: 我刚刚在想你以前可能偶然碰见过他。

lj.lj_ly: When did you run across her?
lj.lj_ls: 你什么时候碰到她的？

lj.lj_ly: We've run across a slight problem.
lj.lj_ls: 我们碰到了一个小问题。

jx.jx_en_mean: To seek the company or attention of for purposes of courting
jx.jx_cn_mean: 追求：为求爱而找伴或吸引其注意力

lj.lj_ly: He finally became tired of running after her.
lj.lj_ls: 他追求她终于追烦了

jx.jx_cn_mean: 偶然撞见：意外遇见；与…偶然碰见

lj.lj_ly: found public sentiment running against him.
lj.lj_ls: 发现公众反对他的情绪

jx.jx_en_mean: To leave one's home, especially to elope.
To stop because of lack of force or power
jx.jx_cn_mean: 停掉，耗尽：因缺乏力量或能量而停止

lj.lj_ly: The alarm clock finally ran down.
lj.lj_ls: 闹钟终于停了

jx.jx_en_mean: To collide with and knock down
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【航海】} 撞沉：与…相撞并导致其沉没

lj.lj_ly: a pedestrian who was run down by a speeding motorist.
lj.lj_ls: 被一辆疾驰的摩托车撞倒的行人

lj.lj_ly: Detectives ran down the suspects.
lj.lj_ls: 侦探抓获了嫌疑犯

lj.lj_ly: The police ran down all possible leads in the missing-person case.
lj.lj_ls: 警察查遍了这件失踪案的所有可能的线索

lj.lj_ly: Don't run her down; she is very talented.
lj.lj_ls: 不要贬低她；她很有天分的

lj.lj_ly: run down a list once more.
lj.lj_ls: 再浏览一下单子

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Baseball} To put a runner out after trapping him or her between two bases.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【棒球】} 夹杀：当跑垒员陷入两垒之间后将其推出

jx.jx_en_mean: To insert or include as something extra
jx.jx_cn_mean: 插入，补入：把另外一件东西嵌入或包括进来

lj.lj_ly: ran in an illustration next to the first paragraph.
lj.lj_ls: 在第一段旁边加上插图

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Printing} To make a solid body of text without a paragraph or other break.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【印刷术】} 使不间断，使不分段，连排：使排字材料不分段落或间隙地连下去

jx.jx_en_mean: To go to or seek out the company of in order to socialize; visit
jx.jx_cn_mean: 非正式访问，顺便看望：为交往目的而去与…相伴；拜访

lj.lj_ly: We ran in for an hour.
lj.lj_ls: 我们拜访了一个小时

jx.jx_en_mean: To meet or find by chance

lj.lj_ly: ran into an old friend.
lj.lj_ls: 与一个老朋友不期而遇

lj.lj_ly: ran into trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 陷入麻烦

lj.lj_ly: His net worth runs into seven figures.
lj.lj_ls: 他的净值达到了七位数

lj.lj_ly: ran off 200 copies of the report.
lj.lj_ls: 把这个报告复制了200份

jx.jx_en_mean: To decide a contest or competition by a runoff.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 对比赛（或竞争）进行决赛

jx.jx_en_mean: To force or drive off (trespassers, for example).
jx.jx_cn_mean: 赶走，驱逐（例如，私入地界者）
不分段，不换行：不间断地接连下去

lj.lj_ly: He is always running on about his tax problems.
lj.lj_ls: 对于他税务方面的问题，他总是讲个不停

jx.jx_en_mean: To become used up; be exhausted

lj.lj_ly: Our supplies finally ran out.
lj.lj_ls: 我们的供给终于耗尽了

jx.jx_en_mean: To put out by force; compel to leave

lj.lj_ly: We ran him out of town.
lj.lj_ls: 我们把他驱逐出镇子

jx.jx_en_mean: To become void, especially through the passage of time or an omission
jx.jx_cn_mean: 期满：因期满或疏漏而无效

lj.lj_ly: an insurance policy that had run out.
lj.lj_ls: 已过期的保险单

jx.jx_en_mean: To collide with, knock down, and often pass over
jx.jx_cn_mean: 碾过：与…相撞、撞倒，通常压过去

lj.lj_ly: The car ran over a child.
lj.lj_ls: 那辆汽车碾过了孩子

lj.lj_ly: run over a speech before giving it.
lj.lj_ls: 演说之前浏览一下演讲稿

lj.lj_ly: The meeting ran over by 30 minutes.
lj.lj_ls: 会议拖了30分钟了

lj.lj_ly: The soldier was run through by a bayonet.
lj.lj_ls: 士兵被刺刀刺透了

lj.lj_ly: She ran through all her money.
lj.lj_ls: 她很快花完了所有的钱

lj.lj_ly: Let's run through the first act again.
lj.lj_ls: 我们再排练一下第一场

jx.jx_en_mean: To go over the salient points or facts of
jx.jx_cn_mean: 匆匆看过：把…的突出点或事实过目一下

lj.lj_ly: The crew ran through the preflight procedures. We ran through the witness's testimony before presenting it in court.
lj.lj_ls: 机组人员又复习了一遍飞行前的程序。在法庭上出示之前，我们先过目一下见证人的证词

jx.jx_en_mean: To make or become greater or larger

lj.lj_ly: ran up huge bills; run up the price of the company's stock.
lj.lj_ls: 积欠很大的债务；使公司股票的价格升值

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rinnan, irnan (verb), of Germanic origin, probably reinforced in Middle English by Old Norse rinna, renna. The current form with -u- in the present tense is first recorded in the 16th cent

encyclopedia.content: George strait于52年5月18日出生于德克萨斯州的普迪特（Poteet），是80年代最有影响的乡村歌手之一。 另有Taylor Swift翻唱版本，歌词稍有不同，括号里加粗内容即为改编内容。 If there's a plane or a bus leaving dallas 如果有飞机或者巴士即将驶离达拉斯 I hope you're on it 我希望你在上面 If there's a train moving fast down the tracks 如果有一列火车在轨道上疾驰 I hope you caught it 我希

entry.def: When you run, you move more quickly than when you walk, for example because you are in a hurry to get somewhere, or for exercise.

example.ex: I excused myself and ran back to the telephone...
example.tran: 我说了声抱歉，跑回到电话机旁。

example.ex: Police believe the gunmen ran off into the woods...
example.tran: 警方认为持枪的歹徒逃到树林里去了。

entry.def: When someone runs in a race, they run in competition with other people.

example.ex: ...when I was running in the New York Marathon...
example.tran: 当我参加纽约的马拉松比赛时

example.ex: Phyllis Smith ran a controlled race to qualify in 51.32 sec.
example.tran: 菲莉丝·史密斯控制好速度，用51.32秒跑完了比赛，获得了参赛资格。

entry.def: When a horse runs in a race or when its owner runs it, it competes in a race.

example.ex: The owner insisted on Cool Ground running in the Gold Cup...
example.tran: 主人坚持要让“酷地”参加金杯赛马会。

example.ex: If we have a wet spell, Cecil could also run Armiger in the Derby.
example.tran: 如果我们遇上持续下雨，塞西尔也能让“扈从”参加德比马赛。

entry.def: If you say that something long, such as a road, runs in a particular direction, you are describing its course or position. You can also say that something runs the length or width of something else.

example.ex: ...the sun-dappled trail which ran through the beech woods.
example.tran: 穿过山毛榉林的阳光斑驳的小路

example.ex: ...a gas-filled glass tube with a thin wire running down the centre...
example.tran: 中部有一根延展的细金属丝的充满气体的玻璃管

entry.tran: 安装(电线、管道等);布线;使（电线、管道等）通过
entry.def: If you run a wire or tube somewhere, you fix it or pull it from, to, or across a particular place.

example.ex: Our host ran a long extension cord out from the house and set up a screen and a projector.
example.tran: 我们的主人从房里牵出一根延长电线，架起屏幕和投影仪。

entry.def: If you run your hand or an object through something, you move your hand or the object through it.

example.ex: He laughed and ran his fingers through his hair...
example.tran: 他笑了，用手指拢了拢他的头发。

example.ex: I ran the brush through my hair and dashed out...
example.tran: 我用刷子刷了一下头发，冲了出去。

entry.tran: 使通过(机器、过程或测试)
entry.def: If you run something through a machine, process, or series of tests, you make it go through the machine, process, or tests.

example.ex: They have gathered the best statistics they can find and run them through their own computers.
example.tran: 他们已经尽力搜集了数据，并将它们输入了自己的计算机。

entry.def: If someone runs for office in an election, they take part as a candidate.

example.ex: It was only last February that he announced he would run for president...
example.tran: 去年2月，他才宣布自己将参加总统竞选。

example.ex: It is no easy job to run against John Glenn, Ohio's Democratic senator...
example.tran: 和俄亥俄州的民主党参议员约翰·格伦竞选绝非易事。

entry.def: A run for office is an attempt to be elected to office.

example.ex: He was already preparing his run for the presidency.
example.tran: 他已经开始为参选总统做准备了。

entry.def: If you run something such as a business or an activity, you are in charge of it or you organize it.

example.ex: His stepfather ran a prosperous paint business...
example.tran: 他的继父经营着一家生意红火的涂料公司。

example.ex: Is this any way to run a country?...
example.tran: 这是治国之道吗？

entry.def: If you talk about how a system, an organization, or someone's life is running, you are saying how well it is operating or progressing.

example.ex: Officials in charge of the camps say the system is now running extremely smoothly.
example.tran: 负责这些营地的官员们说现在这一体系运转得非常顺利。

example.ex: ...the staff who have kept the bank running.
example.tran: 保证银行正常运营的员工

entry.def: If you run an experiment, computer program, or other process, or start it running, you start it and let it continue.

example.ex: He ran a lot of tests and it turned out I had an infection called mycoplasma...
example.tran: 他进行了多项检查，最后证明我感染了支原体。

example.ex: You can check your program one command at a time while it's running.
example.tran: 你可以在程序运行期间，逐条输入命令以对程序进行检查。

entry.def: When you run a cassette or video tape or when it runs, it moves through the machine as the machine operates.

example.ex: He pushed the play button again and ran the tape...
example.tran: 他又按下了播放键播放磁带。

example.ex: The tape had run to the end but recorded nothing.
example.tran: 磁带已经转到头了，但是什么也没录上。

entry.def: When a machine is running or when you are running it, it is switched on and is working.

example.ex: He had failed to realise that the tape recorder was still running...
example.tran: 他没有意识到录音机还在录。

example.ex: We told him to wait out front with the engine running.
example.tran: 我们告诉他在外边等着，不要熄火。

entry.tran: (机器或设备靠某种能源)运转，开动
entry.def: A machine or equipment that runs on or off a particular source of energy functions using that source of energy.

example.ex: Black cabs run on diesel...
example.tran: 黑色的出租车使用柴油。

example.ex: Rows of stalls are given over to restaurants running off gas cylinders.
example.tran: 数排摊位都让位给了使用煤气罐的饭店。

entry.def: If you run a car or a piece of equipment, you have it and use it.

example.ex: I ran a 1960 Rover 100 from 1977 until 1983.
example.tran: 我从1977年到1983年一直开着一辆1960年产的罗孚100。

entry.tran: (火车、公交车等沿固定路线)行驶
entry.def: When you say that vehicles such as trains and buses run from one place to another, you mean they regularly travel along that route.

example.ex: A shuttle bus runs frequently between the Inn and the Country Club.
example.tran: 一辆区间公交车频繁地往返于这家旅馆和那个乡村俱乐部。

example.ex: ...a government which can't make the trains run on time.
example.tran: 不能让火车准点运行的政府

entry.def: If you run someone somewhere in a car, you drive them there.

example.ex: Could you run me up to Baltimore?
example.tran: 你能开车送我到巴尔的摩吗？

entry.def: If you run over or down to a place that is quite near, you drive there.

example.ex: I'll run over to Short Mountain and check on Mrs Adams.
example.tran: 我会开车去肖特山看看亚当斯夫人。

entry.def: A run is a journey somewhere.

example.ex: A run to Southampton showed the car was capable of a reasonable journey.
example.tran: 南安普敦之行表明这辆车还是挺能跑的。

example.ex: ...doing the morning school run.
example.tran: 早上去学校

entry.def: If a liquid runs in a particular direction, it flows in that direction.

example.ex: Tears were running down her cheeks...
example.tran: 泪水滑过她的脸庞。

example.ex: There were cisterns to catch rainwater as it ran off the castle walls...
example.tran: 雨水顺着城堡的墙壁流下时会流入蓄水池。

entry.def: If you run water, or if you run a tap or a bath, you cause water to flow from a tap.

example.ex: She went to the sink and ran water into her empty glass...
example.tran: 她走到水槽边，把空玻璃杯灌上水。

example.ex: They heard him running the kitchen tap...
example.tran: 他们听见他打开了厨房里的水龙头。

entry.def: If a tap or a bath is running, water is coming out of a tap.

example.ex: You must have left a tap running in the bathroom...
example.tran: 你肯定忘了关浴室的龙头了。

example.ex: He came fully awake to hear the bath running.
example.tran: 他完全清醒了，听见浴缸里的水在流。

entry.def: If your nose is running, liquid is flowing out of it, usually because you have a cold.

example.ex: Timothy was crying, mostly from exhaustion, and his nose was running.
example.tran: 蒂莫西正在哭泣，主要是因为太累了，而且他还流着鼻涕。

entry.def: If a surface is running with a liquid, that liquid is flowing down it.

example.ex: After an hour he realised he was completely running with sweat...
example.tran: 一个小时后，他发现自己已经大汗淋漓了。

example.ex: The window panes were running with condensation.
example.tran: 凝结的水珠在窗玻璃上流动。

entry.def: If the dye in some cloth or the ink on some paper runs, it comes off or spreads when the cloth or paper gets wet.

example.ex: The ink had run on the wet paper.
example.tran: 墨迹在湿纸上浸开了。

entry.def: If a feeling runs through your body or a thought runs through your mind, you experience it or think it quickly.

example.ex: She felt a surge of excitement run through her...
example.tran: 她突然觉得浑身激动。

example.ex: All sorts of thoughts were running through my head.
example.tran: 各种各样的想法在我的脑海里闪过。

entry.tran: （感觉或吵闹声）扩散，弥漫，传遍
entry.def: If a feeling or noise runs through a group of people, it spreads among them.

example.ex: A buzz of excitement ran through the crowd.
example.tran: 一时间群情激昂。

entry.def: If a theme or feature runs through something such as someone's actions or writing, it is present in all of it.

example.ex: Another thread running through this series is the role of doctors in the treatment of the mentally ill...
example.tran: 另一条贯穿这部连续剧的主线是医生在治疗精神病患者中起到的作用。

example.ex: ...the theme running through the book...
example.tran: 贯穿全书始终的主题

entry.def: When newspapers or magazines run a particular item or story or if it runs, it is published or printed.

example.ex: The newspaper ran a series of four editorials entitled 'The Choice of Our Lives.'
example.tran: 这份报纸刊登了4篇社论连载，题为《我们生活的选择》。

example.ex: ...an editorial that ran this weekend entitled 'Mr. Cuomo Backs Out.'
example.tran: 本周末刊登的题为《科莫先生退出了》的社论

entry.def: You can use run to indicate that you are quoting someone else's words or ideas.

example.ex: 'Whoa, I'm goin' to Barbay-dos!' ran the jaunty lyrics of a 1970s hit song.
example.tran: “喔，我要去巴巴多斯!”一首20世纪70年代流行歌曲这样欢快地唱道。

entry.def: If an amount is running at a particular level, it is at that level.

example.ex: Today's RPI figure shows inflation running at 10.9 per cent...
example.tran: 今天的零售物价指数显示通货膨胀率为10.9％。

example.ex: The deficit is now running at about 300 million dollars a year.
example.tran: 现在，每年的赤字约达3亿美元。

entry.def: If a play, event, or legal contract runs for a particular period of time, it lasts for that period of time.

example.ex: It pleased critics but ran for only three years in the West End...
example.tran: 它得到了评论家们的好评，但只在伦敦西区上映了3年的时间。

example.ex: The contract was to run from 1992 to 2020...
example.tran: 这份合同在1992年至2020年间有效。

entry.tran: 占用(多于、等于或少于预定的时间)
entry.def: If someone or something is running late, they have taken more time than had been planned. If they are running to time or ahead of time, they have taken the time planned or less than the time planned.

example.ex: Tell her I'll call her back later, I'm running late again...
example.tran: 告诉她我过会儿会给她回电话，我又要晚了。

example.ex: The steward will be able to tell you whether the event is running to time or is ahead of schedule.
example.tran: 组织者会告诉你活动是如期举行还是会提前。

entry.def: If you are running a temperature or a fever, you have a high temperature because you are ill.

example.ex: The little girl is running a fever and she needs help.
example.tran: 这个小女孩发烧了，需要帮助。

entry.tran: (演出或电视节目的)上映期，放映期
entry.def: A run of a play or television programme is the period of time during which performances are given or programmes are shown.

example.ex: The show will transfer to the West End on October 9, after a month's run in Birmingham...
example.tran: 演出在伯明翰上映一个月后，将于10月9日转到伦敦西区。

example.ex: Meanwhile, Dusty Springfield's new TV series began a run on BBC 1.
example.tran: 同时，达斯蒂·斯普林菲尔德的电视剧新作开始在BBC1台播放。

entry.tran: 一系列，一连串(成功或失败等)
entry.def: A run of successes or failures is a series of successes or failures.

example.ex: The England skipper is haunted by a run of low scores...
example.tran: 英格兰队的队长得了一连串的低分。

example.ex: The Scottish Tories' run of luck is holding.
example.tran: 苏格兰保守党人一直好运连连。

entry.tran: 额定产量;单次生产数额
entry.def: A run of a product is the amount that a company or factory decides to produce at one time.

example.ex: Wayne plans to increase the print run to 1,000...
example.tran: 韦恩打算将印量增加到1,000册。

example.ex: Their defense markets are too small to sustain economically viable production runs.
example.tran: 他们的国防市场太小，就经济可行性而言不足以维持生产。

entry.tran: (板球或棒球运动中击球后跑动得到的)一分
entry.def: In cricket or baseball, a run is a score of one, which is made by players running between marked places on the field after hitting the ball.

example.ex: At 20 he became the youngest player to score 2,000 runs in a season.
example.tran: 他20岁时就成为了在一个赛季中获得2,000分的最年轻的选手。

entry.tran: 自由出入的权力;随意使用的权力
entry.def: If someone gives you the run of a place, they give you permission to go where you like in it and use it as you wish.

example.ex: He had the run of the house and the pool.
example.tran: 他可以随意使用这座房子和游泳池。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is different from the average run or common run of people or things, you mean that they are different from ordinary people or things.

example.ex: ...a man who was outside the common run of professional athletes at the time.
example.tran: 当时非同寻常的专业运动员

example.ex: ...trying to accomplish the usual run of maintenance jobs and write a column too.
example.tran: 努力做好维修工的同时还写一个专栏

entry.def: If there is a run on something, a lot of people want to buy it or get it at the same time.

example.ex: A run on sterling has killed off hopes of a rate cut...
example.tran: 对英镑的抢购已经完全扼杀了降低汇率的希望。

example.ex: Loss of confidence could trigger a run on Citibank that would threaten the entire financial system.
example.tran: 民众信心的丧失可能导致花旗银行出现挤兑，从而威胁到整个金融体系。

entry.def: A ski run or bobsleigh run is a course or route that has been designed for skiing or for riding in a bobsleigh.

entry.tran: 爆冷门;逆转局势;出乎意料
entry.def: If something happens against the run of play or against the run of events, it is different from what is generally happening in a game or situation.

example.ex: The decisive goal arrived against the run of play...
example.tran: 这个决定性的得分逆转了场上的局势。

example.ex: Against the run of the polls, the Socialist Workers' Party won Sunday's general election by an unexpectedly large margin.
example.tran: 工人社会党逆转乾坤，出乎意料地以较大优势获得了星期天大选的胜利。

entry.tran: （比赛或竞争中）几乎击败，和…相差无几
entry.def: If you run someone close ,run them a close second, or run a close second, you almost beat them in a race or competition.

example.ex: The Under-21 team has defeated Wales and Scotland this season, and ran England very close...
example.tran: 在这个赛季中，21岁以下代表队已经打败了威尔士队和苏格兰队，和英格兰队的比分也非常接近。

example.ex: The party won at least one county, and ran a close second in several others.
example.tran: 该党派至少在一个郡获胜，而在其他几个郡也和第一名相距甚微。

entry.def: If a river or well runs dry, it no longer has any water in it. If an oil well runs dry, it no longer produces any oil.

example.ex: Streams had run dry for the first time in memory.
example.tran: 记忆中，小溪第一次干涸了。

entry.tran: (信息或金钱的来源)枯竭，用完
entry.def: If a source of information or money runs dry, no more information or money can be obtained from it.

example.ex: Three days into production, the kitty had run dry.
example.tran: 才投产3天凑集的钱就用光了。

entry.def: If a characteristic runs in someone's family, it often occurs in members of that family, in different generations.

example.ex: The insanity which ran in his family haunted him.
example.tran: 家族遗传的精神错乱困扰着他。

entry.def: If you make a run for it or if you run for it, you run away in order to escape from someone or something.

example.ex: A helicopter hovered overhead as one of the gang made a run for it...
example.tran: 当其中一个匪徒逃跑的时候，一架直升机在空中盘旋。

example.ex: Cody, get out, run for it.
example.tran: 科迪，快出去，快跑。

entry.def: If people's feelings are running high, they are very angry, concerned, or excited.

example.ex: Feelings there have been running high in the wake of last week's killing.
example.tran: 上周的谋杀案发生后，那里的人们群情激愤。

entry.tran: 从长远来看/从短期来看
entry.def: If you talk about what will happen in the long run, you are saying what you think will happen over a long period of time in the future. If you talk about what will happen in the short run, you are saying what you think will happen in the near future.

example.ex: Sometimes expensive drugs or other treatments can be economical in the long run...
example.tran: 有时昂贵的药物或其他治疗方法从长远来看可能是比较划算的。

example.ex: In fact, things could get worse in the short run.
example.tran: 事实上，事情在短期内可能会变得更加糟糕。

entry.tran: （因害怕而）躲得远远的，极力逃避
entry.def: If you say that someone would run a mile if faced with something, you mean that they are very frightened of it and would try to avoid it.

example.ex: Yasmin admits she would run a mile if Mark asked her out.
example.tran: 亚丝明承认如果马克约她出去的话，她会极力躲避。

entry.def: If you say that someone could give someone else a run for their money, you mean you think they are almost as good as the other person.

example.ex: ...a youngster who even now could give Meryl Streep a run for her money.
example.tran: 当下甚至能和梅丽尔·斯特里普媲美的一位年轻人

entry.def: If someone is on the run, they are trying to escape or hide from someone such as the police or an enemy.

example.ex: Fifteen-year-old Danny is on the run from a local authority home.
example.tran: 15岁的丹尼从地方当局的收容所逃跑了。

entry.tran: (在比赛中)彻底落败，遭受挫败
entry.def: If someone is on the run, they are being severely defeated in a contest or competition.

example.ex: His opponents believe he is definitely on the run...
example.tran: 对手认为他必败无疑。

example.ex: I knew I had him on the run.
example.tran: 我知道我彻底打败了他。

entry.def: If you say that a person or group is running scared, you mean that they are frightened of what someone might do to them or what might happen.

example.ex: The administration is running scared.
example.tran: 管理部门的人吓坏了。

entry.def: If you are running short of something or running low on something, you do not have much of it left. If a supply of something is running short or running low, there is not much of it left.

example.ex: Government forces are running short of ammunition and fuel...
example.tran: 政府军队的弹药和燃料都所剩无几了。

example.ex: We are running low on drinking water...
example.tran: 我们的饮用水不多了。

means.word_mean: 1. a score in baseball made by a runner touching all four bases safely;

sentences.sentence: "the Yankees scored 3 runs in the bottom of the 9th"
"their first tally came in the 3rd inning"
"in the experimental trials the amount of carbon was measured separately"
"he called each flip of the coin a new trial"
"she broke the record for the half-mile run"

means.word_mean: 5. (American football) a play in which a player runs with the ball;

sentences.sentence: "the defensive line braced to stop the run"
"the coach put great emphasis on running"
"the ship made its run in record time"

means.word_mean: 7. the act of running; traveling on foot at a fast pace;
8. the continuous period of time during which something (a machine or a factory) operates or continues in operation;

sentences.sentence: "the assembly line was on a 12-hour run"
"he has the run of the house"

means.word_mean: 10. the production achieved during a continuous period of operation (of a machine or factory etc.);

sentences.sentence: "a daily run of 100,000 gallons of paint"

means.word_mean: 12. a race between candidates for elective office;

sentences.sentence: "he is raising money for a Senate run"
"she got a run in her stocking"

means.word_mean: 14. the pouring forth of a fluid

sentences.sentence: "the play had a long run on Broadway"
"the team enjoyed a brief run of victories"

means.word_mean: 1. move fast by using one's feet, with one foot off the ground at any given time;
2. flee; take to one's heels; cut and run;

sentences.sentence: "The burglars escaped before the police showed up"

means.word_mean: 3. stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope; run or extend between two points or beyond a certain point;

sentences.sentence: "Service runs all the way to Cranbury"
"My memory extends back to my fourth year of life"
"The facts extend beyond a consideration of her personal assets"

means.word_mean: 4. direct or control; projects, businesses, etc.;

sentences.sentence: "She is running a relief operation in the Sudan"
"the story or argument runs as follows"
"The washing machine won't go unless it's plugged in"
"Does this old car still run well?"

means.word_mean: 8. change or be different within limits;

sentences.sentence: "Estimates for the losses in the earthquake range as high as $2 billion"
"The instruments ranged from tuba to cymbals"
"My students range from very bright to dull"

means.word_mean: 9. run, stand, or compete for an office or a position;

sentences.sentence: "They ran the tapes over and over again"

means.word_mean: 11. move about freely and without restraint, or act as if running around in an uncontrolled way;

sentences.sentence: "who are these people running around in the building?"
"She runs around telling everyone of her troubles"

means.word_mean: 12. have a tendency or disposition to do or be something; be inclined;

sentences.sentence: "She tends to be nervous before her lectures"

means.word_mean: 13. carry out a process or program, as on a computer or a machine;

sentences.sentence: "run a new program on the Mac"
"The car is still running--turn it off!"

means.word_mean: 15. change from one state to another;
17. be affected by; be subjected to;
20. include as the content; broadcast or publicize;

sentences.sentence: "All major networks carried the press conference"
"He ran his eyes over her body"
"She ran her fingers along the carved figurine"
"He drew her hair through his fingers"

means.word_mean: 23. cause something to pass or lead somewhere;
25. deal in illegally, such as arms or liquor
26. cause an animal to move fast;

sentences.sentence: "These dyes and colors are guaranteed not to run"

means.word_mean: 29. cover by running; run a certain distance;
30. extend or continue for a certain period of time;

sentences.sentence: "the heifers run with the bulls ot produce offspring"

means.word_mean: 33. run with the ball; in such sports as football

sentences.sentence: "She always runs to Italy, because she has a lover there"
"Ships ply the waters near the coast"

means.word_mean: 36. pursue for food or sport (as of wild animals);

sentences.sentence: "Goering often hunted wild boars in Poland"
"he is running the Marathon this year"
"let's race and see who gets there first"
"The speech has to go through several more drafts"
"run through your presentation before the meeting"

means.word_mean: 39. reduce or cause to be reduced from a solid to a liquid state, usually by heating;
40. come unraveled or undone as if by snagging;

example.en: Sorry, we had the run-in but it was all my fault.
example.zh: 对不起，我们争吵了，不过那全是我不好。

example.en: l saw the run-in of the thief.
example.zh: 我看到那小偷被拘捕了。

example.en: The thieves divided the spoils and hid it in the each own run-in of theirs.
example.zh: 偷儿们把赃物分了,并将藏在各自的窝赃处。

list.explanation: 使某人经受磨难或磨炼，使某人受折磨，严格测试某事物

example.en: She's quite eager to try again,although they really ran her through the mill.
example.zh: 虽然他们把她折腾得够呛，但她还是想再试一次。

example.en: The new car was put through the mill.
example.zh: 这辆新车经过了严格测试。

auth_sentence.content: He would run right across the pitch with it.
auth_sentence.res_content: He would run right across the pitch with it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He would run right across the pitch with it.

auth_sentence.content: How is the state pension run at the moment?
auth_sentence.res_content: How is the state pension run at the moment?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How is the state pension run at the moment?

auth_sentence.content: Do you run marathons or take part in triathlons.
auth_sentence.res_content: Do you run marathons or take part in triathlons.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Do you run marathons or take part in triathlons.

sentences.en: The dog ran across the road.
sentences.cn: 那条狗跑过马路。

sentences.en: Rabbits run fast.
sentences.cn: 兔子跑得快。

sentences.en: Some of these old cars are still running.
sentences.cn: 有些这样的老车仍在行驶。

sentences.en: Let me run the machine.
sentences.cn: 让我来开动这台机器。

sentences.en: Have you left the bath running?
sentences.cn: 你忘了关浴缸的水龙头了吗?

sentences.en: Please run me a nice hot bath.
sentences.cn: 请帮我放上热水, 让我好好洗个澡。

sentences.en: Catching sight of the dog, he broke into a run.
sentences.cn: 他一看见那只狗, 就赶紧跑。

sentences.en: Oxford to London is about an hour's run by train.
sentences.cn: 从牛津到伦敦乘火车大约有一小时行程。

sentences.en: The boat operates on the Dover—Calais run.
sentences.cn: 这艘船运行的是多佛——加莱航线。

sentences.en: The play had a good run of six months.
sentences.cn: 那出戏演了六个月。

sentences.en: He ran across to a neighbour's house to borrow some money.
sentences.cn: 他急忙到邻居家去借些钱。

sentences.en: He is running with a gang of youngsters.
sentences.cn: 他正与一帮青少年歹徒厮混在一起。

sentences.en: What will be produced if a sow runs with a wild boar?
sentences.cn: 如果一个母猪与一个野猪交配将会生下什么来呢?

sentences.en: The express runs every day between Beijing and Shanghai.
sentences.cn: 在北京与上海之间每天都有快车行驶。

sentences.en: His eyes ran quickly over the letter to see who it was from.
sentences.cn: 他匆匆看了一眼那封信，看是谁来的。

sentences.en: The movie ran for two hours.
sentences.cn: 这部影片延续两个小时。

sentences.en: You mustn't run to your elder brother with every problem.
sentences.cn: 你千万不要一遇到难题就向哥哥求助。

sentences.en: The road runs for 15 kilometers along the river bank.
sentences.cn: 公路沿河岸一直延伸 15 公里。

means.word_mean: 开动，操作(机器等)；使运转

sentences.en: Less power is required to run this kind of motor.
sentences.cn: 开动这种电机比较省电。

sentences.en: She ran a straight line underneath the sentence which she thought important.
sentences.cn: 她在她认为重要的句子下面画上一条直线。

sentences.en: They want to run those rumours and slanders back to their sources.
sentences.cn: 他们想要追查那些流言蜚语的根源。

sentences.en: At last he could not but run his native town.
sentences.cn: 最后他只好从故乡逃走。

jushi.english: The butter will run if you put it near the fire.
jushi.chinese: 如果你把黄油放在靠近炉子的地方它会融化的。
